docinfo.macro:
Mobiles4u

Introducing the new Sony Ericsson P900 PDA as the successor of the very popular P800.

This great Tri band smart phone possesses all the clever features of the P800 and more, including a better appearance as this is a more robust design, and is finished in a very attractive graphite blue and silver colour design, the flip is also not transparent as it was with the P800 and the keys are now backlit slimline silver keys instead of the small plastic keys found on the P800. The flip is also different as when it is closed you can see more of the large TFT 65,000 colour screen and the stylus has been changed so that it is more like a normal PDA stylus and slides into a hole at the top of the handset.

The P900 has an integrated digital MPEG4 video player and still shot camera, and users can stream footage from the internet and send email or MMS messages with this as well as with home video clips and still digital shots, and also can save them to the phone memory, making this great for sharing clips and images with friends and family.

 

For business the P900 uses WAP 2.0 with GPRS for faster connectivity and has Symbian v7.0 interface making it easy to open third party applications and Sony Ericsson have also included a software CD as part of the package leaving it to the individual user to decide what they want to install and download. Users can send and receive emails whilst on the move and also can download and share files and even update the calendar and Bluetooth and Infrared are included enabling you to synchronize data with a PC. The flash memory has 48Mb of RAM, and additional storage space is available using Memory stick duo and supports memory sticks of up to 128Mb.

For leisure use the P900 is java enabled and has games included and once the games are not a challenge anymore new ones can be simply downloaded, meaning hours of endless fun for the user, and a great game V Rally with its stunning graphics is included on the CD. If the user has out played the games they can then listen to there favorite tracks using the built in MP3 player.

Users can also use different types of messaging including SMS, MMS and EMS and instant messaging via the web.

Other features of this handset include phone book and photo phone book, polyphonic ring tones and MP3 ring tones, sound recorder, vibrate alert, touch screen, voice mail and much more making this a perfect PDA handset for both business and pleasure.

• Tri Band
• Symbian OS
• VGA Digital camera
• MPEG4 video player
• 65,000 colour TFT screen 208 x 320 pixel
• Bluetooth and Infrared
• WAP 2.0
• GPRS
• Built in PDA
• SMS with T9 predictive text
• MMS
• EMS
• Instant messaging
• Java capability
• Email
• Sync ML
• Synchronization Apple
• Synchronization PC
• USB port
• Flash memory 48MB
• Memory stick duo
• MP3 Player
• Ring tones - Polyphonic & MP3
• Phone book & Photo phone book
• Sound recorder
• Call vibrate
• Touch screen
• Voice mail
• Talktime up to 16 hours
• Standby time up to 20 days
• Dimensions 115x57x24 mm
• Weight 150g

For more information, please visit this products webpage.

filetype: HTML document, ASCII text, with CRLF line terminators
